meanings.sent1: The children had a rollicking time at the birthday party, laughing and playing games.
meanings.sent2: The circus was a rollicking event, with clowns, acrobats, and music filling the air.
meanings.sent3: The rollicking puppy chased its tail in circles, bringing smiles to everyone watching.
meanings.sent4: The rollicking waves crashed against the shore, creating a symphony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The rollicking dance performance left the audience in awe with its energy and joy.

meanings.definition: Engaging in boisterous merrymaking or festivity
meanings.sent1: The rollicking crowd at the concert cheered and danced to the music all night.
meanings.sent2: The rollicking parade filled the streets with colorful floats and cheerful participants.
meanings.sent3: The rollicking family reunion was filled with laughter, hugs, and shared memories.
meanings.sent4: The rollicking laughter of the friends echoed through the park as they enjoyed a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The rollicking celebration of the team's victory could be heard from miles away.

meanings.definition: Characterized by high-spirited fun or excitement
meanings.sent1: The rollicking atmosphere at the fair was contagious, spreading joy to all who attended.
meanings.sent2: The rollicking game of tag in the backyard had everyone running and laughing.
meanings.sent3: The rollicking movie night with friends included popcorn fights and silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: The rollicking thunderstorm lit up the sky with flashes of light and booming sounds.
meanings.sent5: The rollicking roller coaster ride left everyone breathless and exhilarated.
